context: Hi, want a romantic movie? Say Anything... (1989) is good
I love romantic movies I haven’t seen that one one of my favorites is P.S. I Love You (2007) I will check it out August Rush (2007) was another good one
P.S. I Love You (2007) was good. How about Sleepless in Seattle (1993) and/or When Harry Met Sally... (1989) or even Love Story (1970)
I seen Sleepless in Seattle (1993) I have not seen the other two though which one you would prefer to watch first
Love Story (1970) will make you cry!
awe would it ?! I better make sure I have tissue so then lol and some good popcorn
The Way We Were (1973) is one of my all time favorites.
Another favorite of mine is Pretty Woman (1990) I seen that movie sooo cute
resp: How about An Officer and a Gentleman ?

context.content: Hi there! Do you have a preference for a movie or TV show genre?
I'm really into chilling, terrifying, and suspenseful horror movies, intriguing and suspenseful mysteries, and thrilling thrillers with gripping suspense. Do you have any recommendations for me?
context.feelings: I'm excited to see what the recommender suggests this time. I hope they recommend something that really captures the chilling, terrifying, and suspenseful horror movie, intriguing and suspenseful mystery, and thrilling thriller with gripping suspense that I'm looking for. Let's see what they come up with.

context.content: Based on your preferences, I recommend "Psycho" for a chilling and suspenseful horror movie experience.
Can you tell me more about "Psycho"? I'd like to know about the plot and the overall atmosphere of the movie.
context.feelings: I'm not sure if "Psycho" covers all the genres I'm looking for. I need to ask for more details about this movie to see if it meets all my preferences. The recommender seems knowledgeable, but I'll have to gather more information before making a decision.

context.content: "Psycho" is a classic horror film directed by Alfred Hitchcock. It follows the story of a secretary who embezzles money and checks into a secluded motel run by a disturbed young man and his domineering mother. The movie has a tense and eerie atmosphere with a gripping plot that will keep you on the edge of your seat.

That sounds really interesting! I like the idea of a secluded motel and a disturbed young man. It definitely seems like it has the chilling and suspenseful elements I'm looking for. I'll definitely check out "Psycho"! Thanks for the recommendation. [END]
context.feelings: I like the plot of "Psycho" and the tense atmosphere sounds intriguing. I think this movie could be a good fit for my preferences. I appreciate the recommender's suggestion.

simulator_dialog.resp: How about An Officer and a Gentleman ?
